error.$description: color.alpha.error — Error state semi-transparent background (15% red)

info.$description: color.alpha.info — Info state semi-transparent background (15% blue)

selected.$description: color.alpha.selected — Selected state semi-transparent background (20% blue)

success.$description: color.alpha.success — Success state semi-transparent background (15% green)

warning.$description: color.alpha.warning — Warning state semi-transparent background (15% yellow)

dark.$description: color.overlay.dark — Dark theme overlay (75% opacity). Use for: modal backdrops on dark backgrounds, higher contrast overlays.

light.$description: color.overlay.light — Light theme overlay (50% opacity). Use for: modal backdrops, drawer overlays on light backgrounds.

black.$description: color.black — Pure black. Use for: dark theme text emphasis, high-contrast borders. Contrast ratio with white: 21:1 (WCAG AAA). Rarely used directly - prefer dark.9 for softer blacks or semantic color.text token.

0.$description: color.blue.0 — Lightest blue - primary light backgrounds, selected row highlights

1.$description: color.blue.1 — Light blue - hover backgrounds, info alert backgrounds

2.$description: color.blue.2 — Mid-light blue - progress bars, decorative

3.$description: color.blue.3 — Medium blue - icons on light backgrounds

4.$description: color.blue.4 — Mid blue - primary buttons on dark theme, links on dark

5.$description: color.blue.5 — Base blue - primary buttons, links (light theme)

6.$description: color.blue.6 — Dark blue - primary brand color, main CTAs, navigation active states

7.$description: color.blue.7 — Darker blue - pressed states, text on light blue backgrounds

8.$description: color.blue.8 — Very dark blue - high contrast text

9.$description: color.blue.9 — Darkest blue - maximum emphasis, dark accents

6.$description: color.cyan.6 — Dark cyan - text on light backgrounds

0.$description: color.dark.0 — Lightest dark - text color on dark backgrounds, disabled states on dark theme

1.$description: color.dark.1 — Light dark - secondary text on dark theme, subtle borders

2.$description: color.dark.2 — Mid-light dark - placeholder text on dark theme, icons

3.$description: color.dark.3 — Medium dark - dimmed text, decorative elements

4.$description: color.dark.4 — Mid dark - borders on dark theme, dividers

5.$description: color.dark.5 — Base dark - elevated surfaces on dark theme, cards

6.$description: color.dark.6 — Dark base - primary dark theme background, app shells

7.$description: color.dark.7 — Darker - alternative dark background, sidebar backgrounds

8.$description: color.dark.8 — Very dark - modal overlays on dark theme, deep shadows

9.$description: color.dark.9 — Darkest - near-black for maximum contrast elements

0.$description: color.grape.0 — Lightest grape - premium feature backgrounds

5.$description: color.grape.5 — Base grape - primary grape applications

6.$description: color.grape.6 — Dark grape - text on light grape backgrounds

8.$description: color.grape.8 — Very dark grape - text applications

0.$description: color.gray.0 — Lightest gray - subtle backgrounds, hover states on white, zebra striping

1.$description: color.gray.1 — Light gray - input backgrounds, disabled backgrounds, table headers

2.$description: color.gray.2 — Mid-light gray - borders, dividers, inactive tabs

3.$description: color.gray.3 — Medium gray - placeholder text (use carefully - check contrast), icons

4.$description: color.gray.4 — Mid gray - secondary icons, chart gridlines

5.$description: color.gray.5 — Base gray - dimmed text, help text (4.5:1 on white = AA)

6.$description: color.gray.6 — Dark gray - secondary text (7:1 on white = AAA), labels

7.$description: color.gray.7 — Darker gray - primary text alternative, emphasis

8.$description: color.gray.8 — Very dark gray - high-emphasis text on light backgrounds

9.$description: color.gray.9 — Darkest gray - headings, maximum emphasis text

0.$description: color.green.0 — Lightest green - success alert backgrounds, positive feedback areas

1.$description: color.green.1 — Light green - hover state for success backgrounds

2.$description: color.green.2 — Mid-light green - progress indicators, completion bars

3.$description: color.green.3 — Medium green - success icons on light backgrounds

4.$description: color.green.4 — Mid green - success badges, online indicators

5.$description: color.green.5 — Base green - primary success buttons, checkmarks

6.$description: color.green.6 — Dark green - success text on white (5:1 contrast = AA)

7.$description: color.green.7 — Darker green - success text with maximum contrast

8.$description: color.green.8 — Very dark green - text on light green backgrounds

6.$description: color.indigo.6 — Dark indigo - text on light backgrounds
color.lime.6 — Dark lime - text on light backgrounds
color.orange.6 — Dark orange - text on light backgrounds

0.$description: color.pink.0 — Lightest pink - subtle highlights, badge backgrounds

1.$description: color.pink.1 — Light pink - hover states, selected rows

5.$description: color.pink.5 — Base pink - primary accent applications

6.$description: color.pink.6 — Dark pink - text on light pink backgrounds (AA compliant)

7.$description: color.pink.7 — Darker pink - high contrast applications

8.$description: color.pink.8 — Very dark pink - text on light backgrounds

0.$description: color.red.0 — Lightest red - error alert backgrounds, validation field backgrounds

1.$description: color.red.1 — Light red - hover state for error backgrounds

2.$description: color.red.2 — Mid-light red - progress indicators, decorative

3.$description: color.red.3 — Medium red - icons on error backgrounds

4.$description: color.red.4 — Mid red - error icons on white backgrounds

5.$description: color.red.5 — Base red - primary destructive buttons, critical alerts

6.$description: color.red.6 — Dark red - error text on white (6:1 contrast = AA), danger buttons

7.$description: color.red.7 — Darker red - error text with maximum contrast (8:1 = AAA)

8.$description: color.red.8 — Very dark red - text on light red backgrounds

9.$description: color.red.9 — Darkest red - reserved for extreme emphasis

0.$description: color.teal.0 — Lightest teal - subtle success backgrounds

6.$description: color.teal.6 — Dark teal - text on light backgrounds

transparent.$description: color.transparent — Fully transparent. Use for: invisible interactive areas, overlay starting states, clearfix backgrounds. CSS keyword value - works in all color contexts.

0.$description: color.violet.0 — Lightest violet - feature highlight backgrounds

6.$description: color.violet.6 — Dark violet - text on light backgrounds

white.$description: color.white — Pure white. Use for: light theme backgrounds, text on dark backgrounds, card surfaces. Contrast ratio with black: 21:1 (WCAG AAA). Avoid using directly - prefer semantic tokens like color.body or color.default.

0.$description: color.yellow.0 — Lightest yellow - warning backgrounds (must use dark text)

1.$description: color.yellow.1 — Light yellow - hover state for warning backgrounds

2.$description: color.yellow.2 — Mid-light yellow - caution icons with dark stroke

3.$description: color.yellow.3 — Medium yellow - warning badges (ensure dark text)

5.$description: color.yellow.5 — Base yellow - rarely used for text

6.$description: color.yellow.6 — Dark yellow - minimum for text (check contrast)

7.$description: color.yellow.7 — Darker yellow - warning text on light backgrounds (4.5:1)

8.$description: color.yellow.8 — Very dark yellow - safe for body text on white

9.$description: color.yellow.9 — Darkest yellow - high contrast text
